data.title: Max Born Andres Montes
data.meta_description: Max Born Andres Montes - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. Max Born Andres Montes Period 2 English December 20, 2013

2. Biography  Max Born was born in December 11, 1882 in Breslau (now Wroclaw), Germany (now Poland) and died at January 5, 1970. Born was a German Physicist.

3. Assertion • Max Born is a famous scientist. He is a significant scientist because he made important contributions in the field of science.

4. The Nobel Prize  Max Born is a significant scientist because he won the Nobel Prize for physics with Walther Bothe.“ Who shared the Nobel Prize for Physics with Walther Bothe.”

5. The Nobel Prize: Explanation • Max Born won the Nobel Prize with Walther Bothe for his discovery of quantum mechanics in 1954.

6. Professor  Max Born was a professor at many universities. The two universities were at Frankfurt-am-Main, and Gottingen. “In 1919, he became a professor at the universities of Frankfurt, Main, and Gottingen.” This was the time that Max Born began to replace the original quantum theory. ” His ideas replaced the original quantum theory.”

7. Professor: Explanation • Max Born was a professor at many universities. The universities names were Frankfurt, Main, and Gottingen. Max Born began his ideas to replace the original quantum theory.

8. The Fields of Crystallography  Max Born contributed to the fields of crystallography and optics. “Born also contributed to the fields of crystallography and optics.”

9. Crystallography Explanation • Max Born was also significant for his contribution of crystallography and optics.
